title: Greg Rutherford serves up raw sweetbreads on Celebrity MasterChef UK
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Greg Rutherford made a massive blunder on Celebrity MasterChef as the competition heats up.

With just three celebrities left in the competition, Greg, Vicky Pattison and Neil Ruddock needed to be on their A-game.

At the start of Wednesday’s show they had to serve judges Gregg Wallace and John Torode a plate of food that had a personal connection, and showcased the skills they have picked up on their journey so far.

Greg’s dish, inspired by family holidays in the Alps, was made up of roast rump of lamb with Jerusalem artichoke puree, roasted parsnips and pan fried sweet breads.

When it came to judging time, Greg was let down by one key element of his dish.

John praised his lamb and the ‘earthy’ puree but added: ‘The sweetbreads needed to be cooked more. They’re very soft in the middle. Almost like a paste.’

Greg’s sweetbreads let him down (Picture: BBC)

The judges praised his lamb dish (Picture: BBC)

Gregg added: ‘Your flavours are superb. Your cooking of the lamb and the making of the sauce and the puree is fantastic. So much to admire on there but the sweetbreads are a problem.’

The athlete explained that lamb was one of the first things he cooked to try and impress his wife. Unfortunately she wasn’t a fan but didn’t want to hurt his feelings, so she stuffed it in her handbag instead.

Greg’s dish was inspired by family holidays (Picture: BBC)

Boxer Dillian Whyte was sent home early in the show for undercooking his meringue creation.

The remaining celebs went on to the Chef’s Table round that saw former Geordie Shore star Vicky excel at her lobster dish.

Just one more round remains between the celebs and the MasterChef trophy – who will rise to the top?

Celebrity MasterChef continues Friday at 8.30pm on BBC One.
